reviews.content: Nicolas Cage has steadily built a reputation for being a kooky actor, with recent performances seeing him dialling the craziness up to eleven; Sion Sono is a director who seems to be trying to outdo Takashi Miike in terms of surreality. Prisoners of the Ghostland, from the producers of Mandy, sees Cage and Sono teaming up to bring us what has to be the most thoroughly contrived piece of bizarre cinema I have ever seen. It's wall-to-wall weirdness, but everything feels so meticulously calculated to confound that it proves irksome in the extreme.The basic plot sounds like exploitation heaven: when wealthy warlord The Governor (Bill Moseley) discovers that his adopted granddaughter Bernice (Sofia Boutella) has hightailed it into the badlands, he springs a notorious criminal (Cage) from jail and offers him his freedom if he can bring the missing girl back. To ensure compliance, the criminal is fitted with a leather jumpsuit with explosives fitted to the neck, arms and groin, which will explode if he fails to follow orders.Sadly, Sono's approach makes the movie an impenetrable mess, every frame an exercise in the absurd - if the aim was to make a film guaranteed to bore, irritate and confuse in equal measures, then he succeeded. The director captures some stunning visual compositions with breath-taking use of colour, which makes it all the more frustrating that nothing in the film makes any sense, and most of it is just plain annoying. I have my suspicions that Cage didn't know what was going on either, but he was probably just grateful for the pay check, and does his crazy routine obligingly.1/10. By all means watch if you absolutely have to see Cage holding his own bloody testicle after it has been blown off by one of the suit bombs, but don't say I didn't warn you.

reviews.review_title: What on Earth did I Just Watch?
reviews.content: This is a really weird film. The main premise is understandable, but the rest of what happens in this movie makes literally no sense. I watched this for Nick Cage, and of course Cage does a good job acting his part, but everyone else not so much. 5/10.

reviews.review_title: Tried very hard to be a cool, bizarre, weird, crazy, surrealist, neo-western, horror n action movie but failed badly. Boring movie with one of the worst screenplay.
reviews.content: I am a fan of Nic Cage n i love the above mentioned genres but this one is beyond redemption.Trust me and save ur precious time.In our hindi language we call such kinda atrocious movies CHUTIYAPA.

reviews.review_title: When you're on laced shrooms and bad LSD at a Burning Man festival in a Japanese desert.
reviews.content: That was director Sion Sono's vision, and he did not disappoint putting it on film.However, having actors-turned-wannabe-writers Aaron Hendry and Reza Sixo Safai with barely to no writing experience come up with this screenplay, was wackadoodle. I got annoyed with the number of production companies displayed in the opening credits, you'd think at least one would've invested in a seasoned writer to at least look over the final script. Safi and Hendry wrote a bunch of incoherent, convoluted, plot-hole and technical-issue riddled nonsense.The 103 min runtime, sub-par pacing, and many long dragged out and unnecessary scenes, made this film seem like it was 3+ hours long.Luckily, with Sono's directing and Sohei Tanikawa's near-perfect cinematography, the eye-candy sets, crazy costumes and props, and stunning visuals kept me hooked. The score was fitting and on point. The casting and performances were excellent, especially Nicolas Cage (who this role was made for) and Sofia Boutella.It's a shame no one babysat the writers, as this could've easily been a cult classic. But as is, I'm thinking this would've been a much better music video backdrop for Pink Floyd or Metallica album. It's a very generous 6/10 from me.

reviews.review_title: Weird For The Sake Of Weird?
reviews.content: This movie would be an abomination without Cage but then it doesn't really work with him either. Its a little like the director had too many toys to play with and couldn't decide on which ones to use.Has some moments and is visually interesting but offers little else.

Nicolas Cage did it again! I don't get what his deal is? He's not a bad actor so it's always a mystery to me why he agrees to those stinkers all the time. Does he even read the scripts? Or is it just about money for him? Will he just do anything as long as you pay him? Prisoners Of The Ghostland is another movie with Nicolas Cage that is painful to watch. Not visually though, that was actually fine and that's why I scored it with three stars, but the story, or more the lack of a comprehensible story, that's what makes this movie bad. Nothing makes really sense, you almost know it from the start but you continue watching it in the hope something will change, but it doesn't... Another timewasting movie that I wished I didn't watch.

Without any doubts; Nic Cage and Sofia Boutella could not fail. Well it fails awfully. Please pay attention; I am not drunk
There is a mix of Western, Kabuki theater, Mad Max (?) and the movie itself looks like old Roman Theater with chorus, and signs explaining history. There is also some kind of Ghost in the middle.Nothing really makes any sense; stages have a naïve style like in 60s movies, acting is unbearable (Cage seems to be fooling around). The rest are cartoonish.Sofia Boutella tries but it is impossible for her to save this mess.If you see the comedy "The Play that went wrong" well is basically the same but without any comedy intent.Sion Sono has made some interesting movies in his country Japan and perhaps this have some kind of cultural meaning; but in America is just shamefully absurd for everybody including the viewers.Do not lose your time unless you have to see it to believe it.

reviews.review_title: This was pretty far out there...
reviews.content: Sure, the poster/cover for "Prisoners of the Ghostland" definitely looks really interesting, I will say that much. And yeah, I opted to sit down and watch this 2021 movie given the fact that it was a new movie that I hadn't already seen, and also because it has Bill Moseley on the cast list.Well, "Prisoners of the Ghostland" is a strange movie, even for a Nicolas Cage movie. Even by his standards, then this movie is out there, way, way out there. From the whacked out storyline to the insanely bizarre imagery, props, costumes and sets.I found the storyline in "Prisoners of the Ghostland", as written by Aaron Hendry and Reza Sixo Safai, to be very odd and bizarre. It was so far out there that the movie suffered from it, as it grew annoyingly and frustratingly tough to sit through, as most of the things made little to no sense, or was just so wacky that you just don't get it.The acting in the movie was as to be expected. I wish that Bill Moseley would have been given more on-screen time, because he was - hands down - the best thing about the movie. Sure, it was nice to see Sofia Boutella on the screen, but she seemed to be running on auto-pilot. And this was, for better or worse, just another notch in the strange movie career of Nicolas Cage.The characters and the dialogue throughout the course of "Prisoners of the Ghostland" was pretty bad, and that reflected rather poorly on the overall movie.I am sure that there is an audience out there for director Sion Sono's movie "Prisoners of the Ghostland". But as it happened to be, then I wasn't the target audience. And I can't claim to have found much enjoyment or entertainment in this particular movie.My rating of "Prisoners of the Ghostland" lands on a generous two out of ten stars.

I don't know, Prisoners of the Ghostland got some interesting ideas but the whole affair looks unfinished, unpolished. Even the visual quality of the movie would need some serious editing and reworking - everything looks like some takes from pre-production status. How Nicolas Cage and Sofia Boutella got involved into this movie, I can't understand. For sure, Prisoners of the Ghostland is not the worst movie ever but rather a disappointing and unsatisfying experience. Not recommended, or only to those who want to watch everything that got Cage and/or Boutella casted. This is not a trip on acid but rather a hangover after a night with too much cheap beer involved.

In a weird old west Japanese world, the Governor (Bill Moseley) rules a town with his time obsession and his stable of young women. Ghostland is the wasteland beyond. Some of the girls escape. The Governor uses captured criminal Hero (Nicolas Cage) to retrieve his favorite Bernice (Sofia Boutella). He puts Hero in a leather suit rigged to explode. Hero's former partner Psycho (Nick Cassavetes) is a real psycho.This is Escape from New York and Judge Dredd and whatever craziness coming out of director Sion Sono's brain. Nick Cage is doing more of his weirdness and I applaud him. I want to him all the room he needs. In this case, it's too weird even for me. It gets unwieldy. There's one small example. In the first group tick tock moment, not everybody is moving their heads in the same way. Sono needs to sell that by doing disturbing unison movements. I'm willing to go with the weirdness but it has to be done better. This is style over control. This is walking on a knife's edge. In the end, I can't recommend this except for Cage's completists and Sono fans.

If you want to spend some time with a 2021 Nicolas Cage vehicle, please check out "Pig," which despite that odd title is actually one of the best films of the year and serves as reminder of how great Cage can be with the right material.Despite the director's ambitious vision, there is simply so much that feels reminiscent of the Mad Max franchise. I really wanted to love this film, but I didn't. If you're a Cage fan, Prisoners of the Ghostland is worth a look.
This emphasises the issue that Cage has in selecting scripts that must have been written on toilet paper. This was just crap. Don't waste you time.
The story of "Prisoners of the Ghostland" is poorly explained, and I don't really understand it. Visuals are strange, bordering on bizarre. I can't say I enjoyed it.

No pun intended - prisoners do intend at least to break free. It's not like they do succeed most of the time. At least if you consider over the long run. But this is something different, something really different - a movie by Sion Sono that is starring Nicolas Cage - it did sound like a wet dream come true.Well if you have high hopes for this, you better tone them down. I already had them watered down by others. And even though I did not want to believe them, I have to admit, after watching this - it is rather weird if I were to put it mildly.It still is well done and shot - visually speaking it works. It still has a lot of Nic .. Cageirisms (or whatever you would want to call them). Especially when he holds a speech to rile people up ... while simultaneously cursing them out too.If that is enough for you and you don't mind the craziness - you could do worse. But if you do expect a bit more of a movie that has or rather could have been so much more ... well, do not feel too dissapointed ... unfortunately it was bound to happen (no pun intended).

I actually thought the world-building in this film was quite solid and unique, albeit disorienting. The visuals were very well done, with pretty cool makeup, costume and stage design. That said, the way that it's all put together seems almost random, and the story and script progression are just super weird. The dialogue very rarely makes sense or has any solid purpose, but I guess if you consider that the director Sion Sono has a background in poetry, the abstract dialogue is a bit more understandable.I applaud the studio for making something original and distinctive, which is harder to find these days. However, I wish they had done a lot more with the dialogue and story. You can't just string together random quotes and scenes and expect anything coherent to happen, no matter how good the stage and visuals are.

reviews.review_title: Sundance 2021: Prisoners of the Ghostland is as crazy as one would expect from a movie starring Nicolas Cage... and I love crazy!
reviews.content: If you enjoy reading my Spoiler-Free reviews, please follow my blog :)Nonsensical. Absurd. Ridiculous. Just plain stupid. These words usually serve to describe an incredibly awful movie that I try to forget forever and ever. However, some extremely rare pieces of absolutely crazy filmmaking are also characterized by the adjectives above, offering me the most entertaining time I can possibly ask for. An example of this case is Prisoners of the Ghostland. It's exceptionally dumb, follows a narrative completely devoid of any logic, and mixes up dozens of many genres by using different costumes, all sorts of epic scores, and character archetypes.Boasting an impressive production and set design (major Hollywood studios should be envious), Sion Sono offers the audience precisely what they expect from a film starring the maddest actor alive, Nicolas Cage. From the well-choreographed, well-edited, explosively bloody, hilarious action sequences to the infinite storylines, the viewers either accept whatever lunatic plot point or device the movie throws at the audience, or this is going to be a festival of pointing out what's wrong with the whole film. Prophecies, nuclear wars, zombies, samurais, cowboys... every generic development and formulaic characters we always see in every genre are present in this amalgam of pure chaos.As expected, Cage shines in another role that will probably generate thousands of new memes, but this time Sofia Boutella and Bill Moseley also deliver two captivating performances that kept me invested when Cage was out. The only problem I have with this type of movie is the balance of the whole craziness. I don't mind every single minute being packed with utterly ludicrous stuff, but when it starts getting genuinely confusing, that's when it becomes too much for me to handle. Nevertheless, as long as you keep your mind open and focus on the protagonist's main mission - and solely on that - you'll be able to enjoy this movie as much or more than I did.Prisoners of the Ghostland is everything a film starring Nicolas Cage is expected of being. Possessing technical attributes of making the biggest Hollywood studios shamelessly hide with envy, Sion Sono's movie is as illogical, absurd, ridiculous, stupid, and insanely entertaining as I hoped it would be. By mixing up dozens of distinct genres, the straightforward premise gets sucked into a world of total anarchy, where samurais, cowboys, nuclear explosions, modern cars, and much more collide to surround an otherwise simple narrative with nonsensically hilarious storylines and awesome action sequences. Sofia Boutella and Bill Moseley help Cage tackle this chaos, but the latter is the absolute standout due to his remarkable experience in crazy films. Despite it occasionally crossing the line and becoming too much for me to manage - it becomes seriously confusing - as long as the viewers are well-prepared to accept every jaw-dropping new development, fun is guaranteed with this brilliant satire.Rating: A-

Nicholas Cage continues his streak of incredibly odd film choices. I didn't like this one as much. At first, I was enjoying how wild it was, throwing all kinds of different, silly elements together. Eventually, it just felt like they didn't have much of a story, and the crazy stuff started to get less entertaining. I think the filmmakers thought they were being artsy, humorous, or both. I didn't feel that way.

Brought to you by: Untitled Entertainment; Boos Boos Bang Bang; XYZ Films; Eleven Arts; Saturn Films; Patriot Production; Sion Productions; Baked Studios; Komodo Productions.A combo Leone style Spaghetti Western, e.g. "The Good, the Bad, the Ugly"; steampunk; post-apocalyptic; Japanese art film; surreal Animal Farm. Interesting, creative & would have rated higher, but at the Enoch scene the acting & dialogue turned cheap & bland, becoming too contrived & not consistent with the fantastical wierdness it started with. Dead: 87 by several protagonists.

Nicolas Cage. Seems like that's all it takes to garner instant interest in a film, as the actor has achieved living legend status in the eyes of many genre fans (and for good reason). In his latest, Prisoners of the Ghostland, Cage plays Hero, a ruthless, imprisoned bank robber set free by a wealthy warlord known as The Governor (Bill Moseley, even more to get excited about), and tasked with finding The Governor's kidnapped "granddaughter", Bernice (Sofia Boutella, always exciting, in more ways than one). Taking place in the post-apocalyptic Samurai Town, Cage's Hero is strapped in a leather suit set to self-destruct in 5 days, including detonators located in the vicinity of each testicle (testicuule, The Governor pronounces it), and encounters gunslingers, ghosts, samurai, and a crazed cult. The film puts Cage in an Escape From New York meets Big Trouble in Little China scenario, and the end result is a movie just as wild as you would imagine, an enormously entertaining adrenaline rush that brings the Cage Rage.Once the film is set up and our Hero is on his journey, the film has plenty of unexpected laughs and is very funny at times. It almost works as a spoof of the Western, action genre. "What a badass," "he's so cool," say a couple of awestruck onlookers as Hero chooses a dainty bicycle with a basket instead of the black sports car when he leaves on his journey. He does eventually end up with he car because, tick tock, the clock is ticking on that deadly leather jumpsuit.While looking for Bernice, Hero is lead to a torched, windswept landscape with crumbling mannequins swaying back and forth, cracked and broken shells that conceal prisoners inside of them. Every turn in this world holds a different danger, a threat to end Hero's life at any moment. And all of this is handled with such confidence by director Sion Sono, creating a thrilling and playful and insane world of filthy neon. Imagine Mad Max as a supernatural Samurai Western.In the middle of all this madness is Nicolas Cage, wonderfully off the wall and right at home in such a place. It feels as though the film was inspired by Cage's reputation playing odd characters, giving the film a match-made-in-heaven quality. If Cage gives Prisoners of the Ghostland it's unlikely (anti) hero, it's Sofia Boutella as Bernice who gives the movie its glimmer of hope. It's Bernice we root for as she's the possibility for a brighter future in the Ghostland. What an exquisite performance from Boutella alongside the scene stealing Cage.There's a religious-like fixation on time in the Ghostland. The inhabitants hold the giant clock displayed on the bones-like structure of an old capital building at 8:14, fearing if it hits 8:15 the atomic blasts will once again wreak havoc. The people who live under The Governor refer to him as a clock, as time itself. In the Ghostland, everyone is a prisoner to a forgotten existence, to a lifestyle lost. Time has vanished for the prisoners of the Ghostland, only recognizable in the form of their rulers. This fixation with time really pushes Hero's race against the clock to the forefront, as well as any hope the future of the Ghostland has left.Prisoners of the Ghostland presents a unique vision from filmmaker Sion Sono ( it would make for a great double feature with Ana Lily Amirpour's The Bad Batch). A bloody, dirty, balls to the wall, gorgeous looking blast of color, chaos, and redemption in a land of hopelessness. Nicolas Cage leans into his Nicolas Cage persona, Bill Moseley has fun as a smooth talking, white suit wearing cowboy, and Sofia Boutella steals the show with a subdued, beautifully heartfelt performance. Big time entertainment, Prisoners of the Ghostland is a must see.

reviews.review_title: silly, boring and not worth it
reviews.content: Honestly, I'll never "get" the appeal of Nicholas Cage. He does "over the top" and that's it. I think the only film that I've seen him in that I thought his faux gonzo performance worked, was Herzog's Bad Lieutenant. Anything else that I've seen him in is just silly and/or boring.This is boring and silly. And not "silly" as in "fantastic slapstick comedy", but "omg this is ridiculous". And boring.Save yr money and read a book about film.

reviews.review_title: No art, no action, no plot
reviews.content: This is a gem of false advertising, because this is NOT action movie and even not a good example of imaginative out of boundaries festival cinema. This is epic some how, yes - EPIC FAIL. Actually this film is just small production artsy-fartsy wonnabe retro-otaku-western-art-hause made like in TWO locations around one junkyard. Cage even didn't try to ply he just SHOUT his replics and one time even on japanese even he straight up all time along speaks only english. Why? Even Sono don't know, this is just a mess. Plot here thin as air and don't make any sense in very baaad means. Its not a smart movie, not a great picture from someone who have peculiar fantasies. Its japanese routine for western people: here your Hiroshima complex, there your white dude ball and big sausage (why its EVEN in movie its not fun just stupid how Sono was obsessive about Cage balls). This is bad film from all angles.

reviews.review_title: I wish I washed the dishes instead
reviews.content: What was this movie!! Give me a refund for my time to watch this, I could have had better entertainment washing the dishes after dinner.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I've watched this year so far.
reviews.content: As the title says it all, this is truly the worst movie I've watched. It's terrible, boring and ugly. I really quite understand some contents of this movie. The chantings are the most annoying thing of all. I really hate that.Believe me, watching this movie is a total waste of time. Even you're bored and don't have anything to watch, DO NOT watch this one. There are a lot of good or great movies out there. Just ditch this and go watch the other movies. If you watch this, I'm 99.99% sure that you'd regret just like I did.

reviews.review_title: Cowboys, Geishas and Samurais, oh my!
reviews.content: Coupled with an adjacent village that resembles a Mad Max dystopia made by Terry Gilliam. In short, it's a story about a guy that has to rescue a girl. It's not a standard action movie, normies aren't going to like it as you can see from the bad reviews. It's as weird as Mandy but with the "wtf?" factor toned down a bit. Does it make sense? No, not really. I think there's is a metaphor about time throughout it though. Is it good? Well, it's visually interesting and you'll get some laughs from it.

Nicholas Cage does an experimental Asian period piece. Selected for the Sundance festival. Beautifully photographed. And Cage does excell in his performance. It could even gain a cultstatus, but that's about all I can say that is positive about it.Unfortunately this movie is another FAILED attempt by the (brilliant) Nicholas Cage to star in a good movie. He has been starring in a lot of inferior B-movies lately, but occasionally he does create a new gem, so I am always on the lookout for new Nicholas Cage movies.This movie though can best be forgotten OR be turned into ANOTHER internet meme or into a cult movie...Below are some fun facts about this legendary actor, who has even become an internet meme.His uncle wrote and directed "The Godfather" (1972). Cage was married to the daughter of Elvis Presly. He has named his son "Superman". He discovered and introduced Johnny Depp to acting when he was his neighbour. His favorite movie is "The Wizard of Ozz" (1939). He lives in the former home of John Wayne.And he always sleeps in Swedish pyjamas, which he stores in the freezer. He once woke up in his bed in the middle of the night to find a naked man eating a fudgesicle in front of his bed. He didnt press charges. One of his wishes is "to be Bob Denver on acid playing the accordion".These are the lesser weird trivia facts about the life of Nicholas Cage, many much wilder gossip stories are out there for those who are interested.But Nicholas Cage is firstmost a brilliant actor, who got famous for his big action movies, but he has made much better, smaller pictures that are truly marvellous among which:"Moonstruck" (1987), "Red Rock West" (1993), "Kiss of Death" (1995), "Leaving Las Vegas" (1995), "Adaptation" (2002), "Matchstick Men" (2003) and his latest brilliant comedy "The unbearable weight of massive talent" (2022).Nicholas Cage is still THE MAN. Enjoy one of the many brilliant older classics that he has starred in!

Well, that was pure garbage and a complete waste of time. I am officially going to stop watching any Nicholas Cage movie with a score under 6. I need to at this point. The man will not turn down a script no matter how trash it is.

The film opens with Nicolas Cage robbing the Bleufeur Bank in the surreal Asian/western town of Samurai. We later discover he was unsuccessful in his get away. Meanwhile Bernice (Sofia Boutella) with a couple of friends opt to escape from Samurai Town and they wind up in the equally Mad Max surreal town of Ghostland where no one ever escapes. Cage is given an opportunity of redemption by bringing back Bernice to the Governor (Bill Moseley). His suit will explode in five days if he fails. How does he relieve himself in that?Like many Japanese films the color is beautiful and there is a radiation, nuclear explosion background. I expected there to be some symbolism or metaphor of US-Japanese relations post WWII, but wasn't sure if there was one. I believe I understood the film but missed any point that would make it a decent cult film.Guide: F-word. No sex or nudity.

reviews.review_title: A general disappointment for most involved
reviews.content: After she disappears into the countryside, a bank robber caught in a border town of a lawless frontier is tasked with retrieving her by the nf the week from a reclusive band of mutants, only to discover a deadly force preying upon them and tries to save the group before his mission runs out.While a disappointment, this one does have some enjoyable aspects. Among the bright spots here is the rather enjoyable and over-the-top sense of theatrics found in the rituals on display. Most of this comes from the utterly freaky and bizarre way the town lives, dressing like an apocalyptic band of road warriors, engaging in elaborately choreographed rituals, and outfitting captives in plastic pieces resembling disjointed mannequins while living in the squalor of an abandoned factory while spouting off ramblings of some strange curse involving an accident with nuclear waste creates an intriguing initial premise to work off. As well, when it offers up some action in a sword-fight of hand-to-hand encounter the gore here isn't too bad, but overall these are about all the film has going for it. There are some issues to be had with this one. The main drawback featured here is that, since so much of this is revealed so late into the running time, far too much of the film makes no sense. The band of outlaws living in the abandoned town with their rules and rituals creates a simplistic enough setup but there's nothing about how they tie into the group living in the town under the thumb of the maniacal governor who is constantly barking bizarre orders and commands to the obedient women at his feet or his servants. Even less sense is how the three separate factions are even connected with vague ramblings and nonsensical preachifying making use of just about everything taking place here in an attempt to bring these elements together which fails to do so. The other factor on display here is that there's so little action here it becomes dull and boring after a while. So little of this one features anything remotely resembling what could've been a fun, wild post-apocalyptic style feature involving the fight between a peace-seeking tribe of people stuck in the desert under siege by a roving band of mutated creatures prowling the desert. This one spends so much of its running time on other factors that there's very little interesting here that by the time it finally gets to the big battle at the end to take down the one in charge it's not interesting anymore and just comes off as a violent battle because that's the way the story has to end rather than tying itself together. All told, these features manage to bring the film down significantly from what it could've been.Rated Unrated/R: Graphic Violence and Graphic Language.
Nice theme and concept but useless plot and performances. I think Cage made it for himself.

I used that same headline for my Jiu Jitsu review, another horrendous Nick Cage movie, but it's even more fitting here. I have no idea what this movie is. It's ridiculously weird, and not the good kind of weird. And it's not one or two aspects, it's everything in this movie.I repeatedly asked myself, "why am I still watching this?" I can't believe I finished it. The only reason I kept going is to see if Nick Cage does something outrageous and memorable. And I did get a few hilarious Nick Cage moments. But definitely not enough to make it an enjoyable experience.Prisoners of the Ghostland is utter nonsense and complete garbage. It reminds me of the few super old movies I've seen from the 50s or 60s. It's a bunch of weird nonsense in hopes that people will interpret it in an artistic way. That won't happen here.There were a few parts that were so bad I started to wonder if it was intentional. So I tried watching it as a parody. That didn't work. Then I tried looking at it as a B-movie. Nope. Then a so-bad-it's-good movie. Fail. I tried everything. I understood nothing. I have no idea what they were trying to do.I give them props for creativity. But creative nonsense is still nonsense. (1 viewing, 5/18/2022)

reviews.review_title: Really should have been more fun than it was...
reviews.content: Guess the idea of a Sion Sono directed film starring Nicolas Cage that dips its toes into almost every genre was too good to be true 😔Not that this is terrible, as many of its technical aspects are competent. It's more just that it's bafflingly boring when it comes to its characters and overall narrative, and the pacing is pretty awful. You can tell right from the start, too. There's like two or three scenes that feel like opening scenes, and then the scene that sets up the plot afterwards just goes on and on and on, and that's just the first 20 minutes. Things don't improve a lot from there.Unhinged Cage is fun, as is some of the action, and the film definitely has an interesting look to it at times, but it's strangely dull and lifeless for much of its runtime, and is easily my least favourite Sono film of the half-dozen or so I've watched so far.

What the eff is this trash? Did someone smoke some weed and write a script (and I use the word script in the most liberal sense of the word)? Nothing makes sense and don't even begin to try to call this stupidity art. It's just dumb beyond belief. Could not finish watching.

reviews.review_title: This movie makes no sense and I got exactly what I came for!
reviews.content: Nicolas Cage and Sion Sono are a match made in heaven and it shows in this crazy, surrealist, Neo-Western, Kabuki ghost story.Cage & Sono's styles mix perfectly, complimenting the bizarre yet seamless amalgamation of traditional Japanese & American culture into one world where somehow nothing feels out of place no matter how much absurd stuff is thrown at the wall.

reviews.review_title: Never, Never Before In My life
reviews.content: I'm going to start off looking at the 10 star reviews. I just don't understand how anyone could be so positive about this movie. I felt like I was in a Redlettermedia's "Best of the Worst". Never have I laughed so much and so hard at parts of a film that I did not think were intentionally funny. Never have I ever face palmed so many times or had to stop a movie due to pure confusion. Not confusion due to complexity or something like that but due to wondering "why" as in why did the filmmaker chose any of this? This film is astonishingly absurd and not in a good way.There was one scene that just screamed Mandy and low and behold this film is from the makers of Mandy. I did not like Mandy, Pig, tolerated Willie's Wonderland and skipped Color Out of Space. I'm coming to the conclusion that I just don't like Cage or his acting anymore. I don't really blame him though. The Rock, Con Air and Face Off will always be classics to me but this is pure grade A nonsense. I never put spoilers in my reviews but for this film I just have to mention something that happens in the begin that really doesn't spoil anything but if you are adverse this is your spoiler alert. Cage is given a car to go on his timed quest. He gets out of the car and takes a beat-up bike and everyone thinks he is so cool. At this point I thought the film was going to be intentionally funny and self aware. Nope, he gets about a hundred feet and is stopped by someone who throws him the keys to the same car. He than drives the car...What!? I am still so baffled.Anyways this is getting too long so if you like films that focus on Asian culture, Cage, decent scenery and camera work you might enjoy this more than me but I think I'm being way too generous giving this a 4. I laughed so much. I just, I just don't understand. Why? Why to everything.

Probably the most crazy film I have ever seen. It will go down as a stoner's cult hit. Needs to be viewed as a comedy and don't even try to have it make any sense, its not supposed to.Even though this kind of film isn't my personal cup of tea, I respect the absolute tenacity to make a film like this. And for set design, costumes and ensemble alone, it needs to have 10 stars.There is quite simply nothing like it. Rating it 1-2 stars is really disrespecting absurdity altogether, whether or not you personally enjoy it. I guess absurdism is lost on some people with no creative impulses.

reviews.review_title: Another worst action film by Nicolas Cage! Full of boring conversation, and annoying overuse scene! Avoid at all cost!
reviews.content: This film start with a boy staring at the candy, and a man "Hero" robbing the bank scene! As turnout, this film is about Hero need to rescue a young woman "Bernice" from the so called Ghostland! Entire film full of boring conversation, and super annoying overuse scene! Such as, overuse of the walking scene, overuse of the searching scene, overuse of the driving scene, overuse of the calling names scene, overuse of the arguing scene, overuse of the staring scene, overuse of the flashbacks scene, overuse of the hallucinate scene, overuse of the blackout scene, overuse of the drinking scene, overuse of the shouting scene, and overuse of the singing scene! Make the film unwatchable! All the action scene have blood, and explosion at certain point, but overall portray by sideways, super slow motion, super messy, and occur in too short of time! Make the film frustrated to watch! At the end, Hero saved Bernice out of the Ghostland! That's it! Wasting time to watch!

Genre-bending, yes. But somehow finds a way to ruin each individual genre they play with. Utterly nonsensical plot, weak effects, not a single likable character, horrid dialogue, and some pretty atrocious lighting don't make for a great movie watching experience.

reviews.review_title: Wild and Weird, with great visuals; first half is better
reviews.content: The Hero (Nicolas Cage) is anything but heroic at the start. He and a scummy pal Psycho are bank robbers. But, their last attempt goes sour when Psycho shoots the entire bank staff and the customers. This includes a small smiling boy who loves the banks gumball machine. While Hero is a prisoner of "The Governor" , Psycho is transported by bus when the vehicle crashes with a truck of nuclear waste. This makes a Ghostland where people go to never return. Meanwhile, the evil Governor is incensed when his granddaughter Bernice ( Sofia Butera) - in fact his courtesan - runs away into the Ghostland. He springs Hero and dresses him in a suit equipped with explosives. His order? Go into the Ghostland, bring back Bernice in 5 days or you will blow yourself up. My oh my isn't that special! Hero has no choice. Out-of the safe city gates he goes. He will meet ghosts, clock towers, mannequins, sword fighters and more on his quest. Will Hero bring back the girl? This is one wild and weird film which is an amalgam of other movies, including The Road Warrior, Robin Hood, Waterworld, Westworld, Johnny Mnemonic and more. Much is in Japanese with subtitles truly adding to the enjoyment. It's biggest asset is it's art direction, which is truly breathtaking. Here is a new world, part Wild West and part Samurai, which will amaze and delight. No, it doesn't always make any sense and it loses some steam midway. But, with Cage as the never predictable Hero, many will want to tune in.

So go with me on this.After a prison bus crashed into a truck filled with nuclear waste, a big chunk of Japan was written off and is a lawless wasteland, with one town - Samurai Town - being ruled by The Governor (Bill Moseley) who has a harem of so-called granddaughters as his slaves. All around his small town is what they call the Ghostland, a place where the radiated scum of the Earth live and die and kill. When Bernice (Sofia Boutella, Gazelle from Kingsmen: The Secret Service and Jaylah from Star Trek Beyond), one of the granddaughters, goes missing The Governor makes it Hero's (Nicholas Cage, again the California Kinski of weird roles in stranger movies) job to rescue her.Through movie fate, Hero's old partner was Psycho (Nick Cassavetes), a man who will fill anyone in his way and was the cause of the accident which destroyed most of Japan. And then one of his balls explodes.Yes, Prisoners of the Ghostland isn't your normal movie. It's directed by Sion Sono, who also made Suicide Club, Tokyo Tribe, Why Don't You Play In Hell?, Tag and so many more wild movies over the past few years.Sono has called Wild at Heart his favorite Nicolas Cage movie and one of his inspirations while saying that Cage was "The easiest person I ever worked with, brought me back from the dead." That's because the film was delayed a year after the director had a heart attack.As for Cage, he's referred to this as the wildest movie he's ever made. My jury is out on that one, but this movie looks, feels and acts as odd as its star and trust me, I wouldn't have it any other way. A gang of mutants against angry women and Cage with a sword, one arm and one testicle? I know what side I'm on.
Nicolas.... Come on man. Times are tough I know, but really ? Don't bother.....

reviews.review_title: Nobody watch this movie please. Nothing does not make any sense
reviews.content: Words can't describe how much pain I'm feeling right now after watching this abomination. I just screamed into my pillow to let out the anger this film had caused me. The plot was awful, the acting was atrocious,If you're one of the people rating this film nines and tens you must have some serious problems going on in your lives like do you need any help, I'm being serious you need to seek professional help.

It has some crazy cool style, and such an interesting blend of costuming and era, and just some good fun.But it was like watching the anime movie without having watched any of the individual seasons: I really felt like things were missing. And not just in a "figure it out yourself" kinda way, but in all the ways that someone who'd seen everything/read the book/loved the comics would take for granted.Wasn't even really Nic Cage at his most Cageiest. And he really shouldn't do action scenes that require dexterity, because it looked clunky.Overall, I didn't think it was too bad. But I also didn't think it was that great. Maybe in another day or so, I'll want this to actually be only 3 or 4 stars. But for now, it's okay.Not for everyone, and your life won't have a huge hole in it if you never see this. But also not something to hunt down and watch.

reviews.review_title: Bad does not come close to describing this movie
reviews.content:
Acting bad
Story horrible
Directing abominable
Do not waste your time on this. Honestly if you can get through 15 minutes of this without cringing, you've done very well.Watch Cage's previous movie "Pig". Its everything this isn't!!

reviews.review_title: Cultures clash in this bonkers, symbolic live-action anime
reviews.content: There's a lot to unpack in this sashimi western. Sion Sono's feverish, live-action anime is loaded with symbolism and iconography, a wonderfully strange and humorous lament on Japanese culture. As it was explored in Philip K. Dick's The Man in the High Castle, the Japanese obsession with American culture runs deep, and Sono fuses the two sensibilities here - a frontier western mashed with a feudal samurai drama.On another level, Prisoners of the Ghostland is exploring the nuclear and cultural fallout of the atomic bombs that fell during World War II, as the movie searingly depicts in its final act. The ghosts of this movie are a slaves to that act, as they are slaves to time as commanded by Bill Moseley's deified Governor.Then there are the visual motifs and homages. It's no coincidence Nic Cage's Hero is dressed much like Max Rockatansky, and Mad Max II is clearly a reference point, another film haunted by the remnants of society in a dystopian wasteland. There's even echoes of The Wizard of Oz.Prisoners of the Ghostland will puzzle many and delight some, but ultimately it's a far more layered and intelligent piece of filmmaking than most will give it credit for. It's cinema as art, impressionistic, multi-faceted and worthy of dissection.I had a ball.

reviews.review_title: I honestly don't get the hate
reviews.content: So I looked at the rating for this film on this illustrious website and was aghast. This was well after watching the movie mind you. So what the heck people?Now to begin with, the story is pretty razor thin. Basically, Nic Cage needs to rescue a concubine from an evil redneck who goes by the moniker "The Governor." As Cage tries to track her down with a plethora of bombs strapped to his body, Cage traverses the fine line between a post apocalyptic wasteland and an Asian extreme nightmare. Cage stumbles into a weird society trying to survive, mostly by holding back a clock and keeping time from moving forward. It's a bizarre premise, but it works. And that is it. That's the story. Aside from some offshoot scenes to show how dangerous certain individuals are, there is not much left to talk about.I will say this...the movie is visually out there. Mixing elements from World Gone Wild and The Good, The Bad and the Weird, the visual aesthetic mixes westerns, Japanese period pieces and DIY post apocalypse. It doesn't always work but it looks wild. In the end, that is the saving grace, because the only real weakness was the script. While I have no issue with reading subtitles, I'm sure the pressure to get foreigners to speak English to help with the marketing was not really necessary. Part of the problem was understanding the character's speech, which was a challenge at some points due to the massive number of people shouting all together.Overall, between the four main films that XYZ Films has made, this is arguably the weakest. Cage obviously took this one due to the self indulgence of the character, which is fine by me. Oh well, at least it was cool to look at.

Let's be honest. If this movie was in bock and white, made in any other language but English and had clarinet prominent on the soundtrack it would be viewed as artistic genius.Nic Cage in a weird pseudo Japanese western with flashbacks, Shakespeare allusions and 1 testicle. Do I like this movie? No. Do I hate it? No Is it worth watching? Yes
Maybe it's the jumbled mash of ideas. Maybe it's just I wanted to like it. Maybe it was the wine and beer but either way. Worse ways to spend an evening.

When Oscar-winning "Leaving Las Vegas" actor Nicolas Cage dominated Hollywood's A-List, he attracted not only the most acclaimed directors, but his theatrical features also grossed millions. After a string of flops ousted him from the A-List about a decade ago, Cage parlayed his belated stardom into paycheck movies to maintain visibility. Now, his movies illuminate select theatres for seven consecutive days before they hit home video, so they can qualify for Oscar competition. Since then Cage has toplined some genuinely bizarre films. In director Panos Cosmatos' "Mandy" (2017), he was an avenging husband who pursued a Charles Manson-type cult leader that had abducted his wife. Going full metal psychotic, Cage forged weaponry straight out of "Conan the Barbarian" so he could carve up her captors. In an atmospheric adaptation of H. P. Lovecraft's novella "The Color Out of Space" (2019), Cage played a conflicted father whose house sat on a portal to Hell. Afterward, he made the haywire occult comedy "Willy's Wonderland" (2021) where he uttered not one word of dialogue and waged a war against demonically possessed robots in a Chuck E. Cheese style rec center. Preposterous cockamamie from fade-in to fadeout, Japanese director Sion Sono's "Prisoners of the Ghostland" qualifies as so bad that it might be good, depending on your tolerance for its frivolous, infantile escapades. Quoting Cage: "It might be the wildest movie I've ever made, and that's saying something."
Now, in his first English-language film, Sono casts Cage as an anonymous bank robber given an opportunity to redeem himself. The first half-hour unfolds in Samurai Town, a cross-cultural synthesis of an ancient Japanese village and an American Wild West cattle town. The authorities are Asians dressed like Marshal Matt Dillon's deputies on TV's "Gunsmoke." The town teems with giggling, kimono-clad geishas, pistol-packing Old West cowboys, and swashbuckling, katana-toting Yakuza warriors. The Governor's agile bodyguard, Yasujiro (Tak Sakaguchi of "Yakuza Weapon"), wields his razor-sharp katana like a demented wizard. The brief sword-fighting interludes evoke memories of bloodthirsty Asian martial arts epics. The dreaded Ghostland sprawls on the outskirts of Samurai Town and evoked memories of the dystopian, post-apocalyptic, "Mad Max" movies. Basically, chaos erupted when our nameless protagonist and his trigger-happy accomplice stormed into the Bleufleur National Bank and carried out an audacious daylight robbery. During this ill-fated fracas, Psycho (Nick Cassavetes of "Blind Fury") blew away eight innocent bystanders. One of the casualties was an adorable little boy who collected gumballs.Now, many years later, the ruler of Samurai Town, the Governor (Bill Moseley of "The Devil's Rejects"), a sleazy good ole boy with a countrified Foghorn Leghorn drawl, releases the bank robber from captivity. Clearly, the Governor dreams of being as villainous as Boss Hogg on "The Dukes of Hazzard" and attires himself in similar white apparel with boots and a Stetson. He wants Cage's character to infiltrate the Ghostland and find one of his euphemistic "granddaughters." Actually, a courtesan in his harem, Bernice (Sofia Boutella of "The Mummy") sought her freedom, stole a car, and careened off into a landlocked Bermuda Triangle of phantoms. Although he believes the bank robber can retrieve Bernice, the Governor takes no chances. Not until our anonymous protagonist has zippered himself up into a black leather jumpsuit and snapped all the latches shut, does the evil Governor enlighten him about the explosive charges at his throat, elbows, and genitals. Indeed, this booby-trapped outfit could vaporize him if he tries to go AWOL! Anybody remember John Carpenter's cult sci-fi thriller "Escape from New York" (1981) where Kurt Russell's Snake Plissken fought the clock to rescue the President and receive the remedy for the poison in his body? The Governor promises our hero a reprieve if he delivers Bernice within five days. As it turns out, the "Ghostland" of the title is actually a nuclear wasteland. Incredibly, we're told that a bus carrying prisoners collided with a truck hauling nuclear waste, and the cataclysmic destruction irradiated the desert outside Samurai Town! Now, anybody who enters the Ghostland is forever trapped within its eerie confines. Some prisoners disguise themselves like department store mannequins while others struggle to turn back the hands of time on a monumental clock tower.A lukewarm, post-apocalyptic, supernatural, samurai western, "Prisoners of the Ghostland" depicts our hero's derring-do as he rescues Bernice but sacrifices some of his body parts. "Suicide Club" director Sion Sono and writers Aaron Hendry & Reza Sixo Safai must have been flying high on nitrous oxide when they concocted this psychobabble pabulum. Sono deprives the Nicolas Cage hero of any dignity. For example, when the Governor parades Cage from prison into the public, our hero is dressed like a sumo wrestler, with his haunches hanging out of a grimy thong. Similarly, Cage mocks his own image in "The Rock" (1996), "C0n Air" (1997), and "Face/Off" (1997) and often gets what he deserves when he behaves like a lout. Screwing up accidentally, he sets off an explosive crotch stud. BOOM! Predictably, our hero lost one for the team where it really counted. Few traditional heroes are made to suffer such ignominy. Later, after an explosion maims an arm, Cage augments that appendage, too. Happily, well-armed and quite angry, Bernice surprises the Governor. Altogether, a colorful Rorschach inkblot with richly symbolic imagery and ideology, "Prisoners of the Ghostland" will either enchant you with its grandiose farcicality or make you cringe in agony at its surreal shenanigans.

Yes it's a crazy and weird movie. But it doesnt try to be anything else. And it's quite entertaining. And it's always great to see Nick Cage doing one more off main stream acting. Thats what makes it all great. And all the lamers that gives one star rating, should stick to watching main stream movies only. This movie is art. Yes weird art. But the weirdness is what makes this movie great. And Nick Cage is perfect for the role and a great actor as allways.

The return of Nicolas Cage, highly recommended. It shows all the current problems in the world in a matter of 2 hours. Oscar deserving 100% Excellent score, cinematography, great action scenes, and it's funny too.

reviews.review_title: Against the odds, eventually it does come together
reviews.content: What is first pretty laborious, actually begins to coalesce into some themes along with a functional aesthetic, and an actual plot. I'm surprised as you. I was very close to bailing on this in the first 15-20 minutes.I have a few caveats before I get into my reading of this: Nicholas Cage was not good in this movie. The score was really forgettable; during the duel, arguably bad; and the script could have been a lot better. I feel like the director would have driven much of what was actually good to watch here, rather than pulling from the script like normal.So how did this become a 7? The town being ambiguous. Neither west nor east, felt like it was turning the orientalist aesthetic we see in much of sci-fi (especially cyberpunk) on its head. Here's some neon and some weird western brands lit up in Japanese architectural riffs. See how weird and kind of stupid it is?This feels like it ties into the white saviour angle. It had me puzzled for a while. Why is this person sent, of all people? He displays no real skill compared almost everybody else. But when we see that actually Bernice was not captive at all; she ran away and is now literally masquerading as something she is not within a mannequin. Trapped in a shell despite trying to find some kind of freedom. She has also lost her voice. Rather than someone capable, they send a white guy to return her, essentially a victim of sex trafficking, we find out later, to the white man governor. I think it's because it's assumed his morals would have no problem with it.And of course, the governor has no morals and has no intention of allowing him to go free, anyway. At which point the character we thought was mentally ill ends up trying to save her friend and show more moral fibre than anyone has so far. A nice touch, considering she is basically demeaned throughout until this time.By listening to his conscience in a kind of restorative Justice, Cage is able to actually be an effective fighter and enable the actually wronged party, Bernice, to kill the governor, who represents the institution that has imposed its will on this town. Where time has literally not been allowed to continue until his death.The only part that feels thematically discordant to me is the samurai warrior who is clearly better than everyone else, who fights to have his sister released from the Governor, ends up wanting to kill Cage, and dies at his hand. I'm guessing the samurai was the little boys brother, or something? I wasn't sure why he had to be the one to kill Cage and defended him until the duel; unless it was merely to see who was better. If so, that's pretty boring for a B plot, tbh.Anyway, I liked that Cage's freedom comes at the hands of Bernice. There was no indulgent sex scene and the only one who looks like a fool-as most Asians are made to appear in cinema, especially in Westerns-was Cage. (Another reason he shouldn't have fought a samurai and win, tbh).Time starts again. The town will be able to flourish. And the former mentally ill person, who was probably just gaslit bu the governor and the only sane person reacting to all the wild stuff happening, doesn't die; subverting another trope.In the end, it comes together fairly well and has some interesting themes it's playing with. It's over-the-top and silly sometimes, but it has a point and it's trying to look and be it's own thing. I respect that. It's disappointing, however, how much better it could have been with a better script though. It could have actually been quite intelligent and more interesting.

All the low ratings are from the brainwashed people who cannot think for themselves and have been conditioned to the same old same old.Of course it's not a full 10, but I'mma boost it up so people with imagination and a sense of adventure with open minds would indulge into a whirlpool of unusuality.Some tard said there is no plot here, have you even watched the movie? Rofl. The plot is very simple and well, I forgive that because the setting and atmosphere is very fun and amazing. I love the plot takes itself very seriously, yet how it is played out - doesn't, which makes it fun to watch. Also this art has many absurd comedy parts which were pretty hilarious.Another great quality of this movie that for me it felt like I was in a theater watching it live on the stage, it really had that atmospheric element with all of the costumes and the scenery. And yeah the acting was frogging great, Nic Cage and others delivered.

Sion Sono has made a wonderfully imaginative movie that so effortlessly blends so many different ideas and genres from comedy, to action to dark and poignant themes. All the actors do a great job, particularly Sofia Boutella and Nic Cage with a wild performance. Also, the cinematography is wonderful, elevated by the beautiful colours. However, where the film suffers for me is that the plot feels almost "clunky" without any natural flow, events seem to just take place. This bizarre world also isn't established too well, and it felt as if there needed some form of exposition, not too much, but more than it gives. Nonetheless, this movie is exceptionally entertaining, despite its flaws, particularly thanks to Nic Cage's performance.

reviews.review_title: Prisoners Of The Ghostland is one weird film...
reviews.content: Prisoners Of The Ghostland is one weird film... It's more like a cinematic arthouse film with a mixture of genres and a crazy performance from Nicolas Cage ... Don't expect a lot from the movie... It's just one ride that is funny and bizarre...
This is what happens when you let creativity flow without restrictions - AND add Cage to the mix.Absolutely loved it - it was unexpected, funny and full of action. 10/10 and then some!
This movie is one of the worst movie that I have seen this year. It is considered as an action movie yet it has no action scenes.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely Insane and Surreal..Too Crazy to make any Sense.
reviews.content:
Well,its always fun to see Nick Cage do crazy and this movie is a good medium for it! Surreal and insane as in "mandy" crazy! Not really my cup of tea and I'll admit to fast forwarding thu alot of the
lunacy..the testicle scene though had me laughing hard! You'll Know the scene I mean..enough said! Aside from nick doing nuts as only he can, the scenes with Bill Moseley doing an Outstanding impression of literally channelling Dennis Hopper..Now That was trippy! Close my eyes and I could see Hopper saying the lines..Sofia was painfully beautiful to look at...I dont know whats up with these directors and writers,Are they high on crack and LSD when they make movies like this? Yeah it feels Otherworldly and oh so surreal with all the people standing around staring mindlessly behind masks, screaming like lunatics.. Who thinks of stuff like this and How does it ever get produced? I give it 2 stars for nicks epic crazy moments and Bill Moseley's channeling of dennis hopper from the grave..Overall if you wann see Nick go Nuts, there are Better movies..Mandy and face off are way better than this mishmash..

reviews.review_title: There is artsy .... and then there is full artard.
reviews.content: People who thinks this film is good are the same ones that will tell you a chimp splattering paint on a canvas makes it art.

reviews.review_title: A lot of fun. Very strange. Hilarious in parts.
reviews.content: Look, if you're gonna bash Cage, call this movie stupid, tell me it doesn't make sense etc. Etc... Then you clearly have no taste for ultra strange, surreal dark comedies or have any concept whatsoever of mythology (the hero's journey) This movie isn't trying to impress some cranky jerk who's out to bad mouth it weirdness, art direction or over the top lead actor. It's truly just being what it was meant to be, and I find integrity in that. This movie was really entertaining. Just go with it. It's meant to be surrendered to. It's an art film I guess, but it does follow a plot with structure. It's just utterly surreal, silly and totally flippin nuts. Hopefully you'll make it out with both of yours.
I love Nicolas Cage but this movie is crazy weird and clinically stupid, I forced myself to continue watching and I couldn't go past the 30 minutes mark, for the sake of my sanity..
How to describe this trip its a western mixed with mad max on acid with a dash of waterworld but on land. Its ever so crazy and fun and sure as heck be a cult movie pretty soon.

Cage in Pig quite impressive which I watched a month ago and after this, give me a feeling in back to square one. Cage really a non dead tree in movie world. He may be the actor appeared in most movies in all times. Story itself just soso for sci-fic theme.

reviews.review_title: Is there really a Ghost in the Machine?
reviews.content: To understand this movie, you got to get loaded! Remember- life in a post-apocalyptic society with NO control over government, religion or people, the only reason to live is to survive. After four beers it started making sense. With chaos came anarchy; along with different colors, creeds and languages. You see the ugliness of what mankind has become and is capaple in the struggle to survive and life rendors no significance. And then the realization came... perhaps we're not really ready to survive due the acts and evil that men do. Nick Cage can be a prophet or a fool, but even the fool must be no simpleton. This movie is ugly and not filmed in a nice setting, but it made a point!

I like bizarre arty movies. I like Nicholas Cage nonsense (I did enjoy Willys Wonderland). I like cartoon violence. I like Asian imagery.This should've been an easy win.It stank. Go watch Bunraku instead.

I ended up walking out of this movie. I'm a big fan of Cage's gonzo approach to films, and appreciate the whacky, nonconformist nature of his work. While many of his movies skate on that artistic edge of absurd/genius, this one just kinda sucked. Felt contrived to the point that it was unwatchable.

reviews.review_title: Could have been much much much better
reviews.content: I can only assume that someone had an idea about a film then forgot what that was but decided to film anyways. My niece used to make up stories when she was 5 and their were much better and believable.Some parts were ok and the ethos of the story was ok but on the whole just a pile of nonsense.One thing that always gets me is these testicle things that have happened more than once in movies... what kind of testicle or scrotum do these people have as it is virtually impossible to blow off just one testicle, plus how on earth did it end up in his hand...I am possible now dumber for watching this film in its entirety.

I made it through 30 minutes of this. I just couldn't be bothered watching it any further. It's annoying to watch and not entertaining. It has more style than substance but not that much style that you'd want to watch all of it.

I love Nic Cage. He's one of a kind, and you can see why the director would choose him for this film. It's wacky, trippy, mad as a box of frogs... but it just doesn't have the gravitas of other cage bonkers films like Mandy, Raising Arizona, or Willy's Wonderland. There are some great samurai moments, sword fighting choreography etc, but the other loony ideas end up being lost in a loose script.

If you'd put Mad Max, Army of Darkness, and The Running Man in a blender and it was directed by Akira Kurosawa on acid, it would be this movie... It doesn't make an oz of sense but it is a beautiful freaking ride anyway 🤘💯

7.5/10
I really really wanna give the movie a higher rating than Nicolas Cage's previous movie, Pig, but it is what it is, unfortunately at in the end, the movie still cannot reach that point, but did i still prefer Pig than this?, No, because somehow someway Prisoners Of The Ghostland is simply a better movie, and besides all of that, Prisoners Of The Ghostland is strongly perform by Nicolas Cage and Sofia Boutella, the color, the cinematography, special effect, and Japan as always been a perfect location, Prisoners Of The Ghostland still delivers a good action packed, not perfect in the storytelling and that's the big issue in the film, but it's still worth watching, overall, Prisoners Of The Ghostland is pretty good.

The plot is less complex than 'Escape From New York' but stuffed with so much random filler. Everything else is even worse from the acting to the visuals; leaving you with a confusing and insulting mess.3/10 an insult to Japanese culture.

reviews.review_title: What the H-E double hockysticks did I watch?
reviews.content:
Here's The 4K Lowedown on "Prisoners of the Ghostland" (NR - 2021 - Blu)Genre: Sci-Fi/Post Apocalyptic
My Score: 5.1Cast=5 Acting=5 Plot=6 Ending=7 Story=2
F/X=6 Pace=5 Intense=4 Dystopia=5 Violent=6The Governor offers the prisoner his freedom in exchange for retrieving the runaway. He sets off on a journey to find the young woman and his own path to redemption."Your trousers are also equipped with explosives...one at each test-e-quel." What the hell did I just watch? It was like Escape from L. A. took a bad acid trip...I didn't understand what was going on. I love Sofia Boutella but I was so disappointed in her role. The only thing I honestly liked about this movie was the ending...not just for the fights but because it was finally over.

In recent years, I started to think Nicolas Cage's choice of films to be interesting. Somehow, I even started to enjoy a movie like Willy's Wonderland as my guilty pleasure. So despite the bad reviews, I went to see this with a mild expectation. But boy, it was bad! It was nothing like bad but enjoyable or cheesy but fun. It was just plain horrible. The movie was like a pretentious amateur play, and it was torture to sit through the whole 103 minutes. I never believed in giving one star to any films but I changed my mind. Definitely the worst movie of the year.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful but unforgivably dumb and impenetrable
reviews.content: In a classic The Simpsons episode, Moe describes "po-mo" (post-modern) as "weird for the sake of weird," and this is exactly the garbage he was talking about. And I would add that it's also stupid for the sake of stupid.Let's start with the single positive about this movie: it looks very pretty. But while I might suggest watching other pretty' movies on mute, I wouldn't even recommend that for this piece of garbage, because interspersed with the beauty of some of the shots are some deeply stupid group performances (like everybody singing and clapping in unison, or everyone clapping and dancing in unison, or everybody speaking and clapping in unison...a lot of clapping in unison overall. Too much clapping. What the hell was the point of all the clapping?!)I don't even want to spend time pointing out some unexplained plot holes, because the rest of the movie is as stupid and useless as any of the plot-hole-filled scenes. Everything about it is so dumb. It is so condescendingly bad that it becomes insulting and a clear waste of time.The time I spent with this movie made me feel like I was stuck hearing a flat-earther describe their evidence, or a destitute 'professional' gambler explain to you their "system." I hated every second of it.I still want to believe that there was a point to it, because it was pretty. So I would watch it again with someone who understands it, and could point out in real-time all of the metaphors, and artistic story points that I obviously missed. For now, I still hate it. I completely understand the reviews that say they were angry while watching.

Prisoners of the Ghostland is a movie which trips while starting its engine. From the very first frame the presentation feels janky enough to make you reconsider your choice. The main attraction Nicolas Cage and all the other actors delivers a performance that just looks okay but doesn't give any feel on top of anything. Both the screenplay and editing are all over the place from the first act till the end. The story itself feels like puzzle pieces that are put together without any proper idea or vision. Director Sion Sono made a movie where the audience can pass their time watching it but when it comes to the presentation the audience will have a hard time connecting to anything because of how janky and cringy it looks. Overall its a movie you can totally skip watching or if you have time to waste then you can definitely give this a try.

Nicolas Cage must be stopped from acting and encouraged to do something else. Couldn't he just pick up trash along the highway to pay back his debt to society, whatever that debt is? Instead, we are faced with a cascade of ultra-violent rubbish that does more damage to the American psyche than a civil war. Id wager that his movies are the favorites of mass shooters.This was so bad that I couldn't even finish watching the trailer with its terrible dialogue and absurd plot which we've seen a million times. Covering up the lousy story with a lot of glitter and sci-fi silliness won't fix this liability; that would be like putting a bikini on a 95-year-old which doesn't make the person sexier, it simply highlights their flaws.The more movies like this that are presented to the public, the more I stay away from the TV and read books.

reviews.review_title: Gunfight At The Samurai Coral During An LSD Acid Trip With The Patients Of The Ghostland Mental Health Institution!
reviews.content: The vibrancy of colour is beautiful and the bombed out look of the sets is amazing, with a truly battlefield of destruction appearance. There is only one instance of nudity (which is fine as it did not need it to enhance the plot any further) where a Geisha brothel worker exposes her right breast and nipple. The mix of dress styles from Japanese Kabuki theatre, Cowboy fashion, Hobo tattered rags, a bit of Cyberpunk and a blend of traditional Samurai clothing works splendidly. The Martial Arts sword fights were very well choreographed, as was the town Gunfight shoot out wild west style and was not a balance out of place at all.The whole visual scene is outstanding but alas the script and the story flow are sadly missing altogether! Its confusing, crazy, outlandish, disjointed, totally wacky and comes across as if its a bunch of escaped mental patients stoned out of their minds on LSD. And that is why it only gets a 4 star rating from me; as well as for the segments that make no sense, are boring or pointless. Its a huge world apart from the style of his last film, 'PIG', which I really liked, so I am very curious as to what on earth he will do for his next film!

reviews.review_title: Worse than pig and that was bad
reviews.content: Just another bog standard nick cage money spinner with a terrible story, avoid at all costs, trust me you've been warned.

.. i mean, if you can accept that Ghostland WANTS to be bad, then ok, you can watch it. But if you are expecting this to be a standard film, following the standard rules of entertainment ..Instead Ghostland is a film where everything is too much. Everything is over the top. But those who wrote this, knew what they were doing. Example:
The super-obvious copy of the Escape From New York "exploding capsules" trick; you can either believe that whomever wrote that doesn't know about John Carpenter, or you can believe that they totally do, not only do they know John Carpenter, they also know Fritz Lang - and have a massive onscreen reference to Metropolis, that NOBODY from the audience of this film has watched. They reference Lone Wolf & Cub, and a ton of good-to-mediocre, but well known japanese "period" (i.e. Samurai) films, but also some American 60s, early 70s films as well, some from B&W era. And Mad Max, obviously.And see the incredible photography, the gorgeous sets, the excellent costumes, everything about the production of this film is stellar.To be honest, it's not perfect. The pacing is off, and the film doesn't have that kind of "breathing beat" that really, really should have been here, considering what kind of product they were making.Ghostland is very similar in intent to Cabin In The Woods. It's easy for someone to watch it and completely miss ALL the references. To just see it as it superficially appears. And, in my opinion, the filmmakers should have added a few extra "winks" to the audience to let them in on the joke.I predict this film will become a cult classic in the coming years.Don't watch it, you wouldn't appreciate it.My vote: 7/10.

I like Nicolas cage I think he's an entertaining actor. I even liked most of his bad movies. But I stopped watching this movie after 30 minutes and its pretty rare for me.I get it they wanted to make a weird movie. But this is just not a movie. It's just a bunch of very weird dystopian settings, weird dialogues. And non existent story. It feels like it was made by somebody on drugs overdose. And if you are thinking ok that might be something like these 80's Mad max/Blade runner movies and it might be fun you are wrong. These movies were creatively weird but had great acting, interesting plots and scenes. This one is nothing like that it's just bad.
Walked out after 35 minutes and I was stoned no less. Just couldn't take it anymore. No idea what this was supposed to be but it was so bizarre it was unwatchable.

Too thin and obvious to become the cult classic it desperately wants to be. Unfortunately, there is no real story, acting is average (apart from Cage and a few others), and surprisingly little action (and done surprisingly clumsily).All the characters were sadly entirely forgettable, or completely unused, except for the samurai, The Governor, and Cage.This one just proves that you can't throw a bunch of filters, 'crazy' wasteland characters, and sets into a movie, and have it come out well.

What a major disappointment! I thought Nic Cage was rising again after Willy's Wonderland and Mandy but what the hell was this atrocity!?!? As others have stated, Nic must owe someone money or lots of favors. To be honest, Nic Cage making a crappy ass movie was not the biggest surprise to me.... Sofia Boutella being in it was one and learning Imogen Poots was originally cast instead of Sofia but dropped out when Nic had the movie moved to Japan! Baffles the mind. Crap! Crap! Crap! Trust me...go watch it and if you can make it all the way through you'll feel like everyone else and compelled to write a review in an attempt to warn others.
This was dreadful.3 stars merely because production levels were professional... but the acting.. the script.. all very weak.

This movie has no redeeming features. Not even the ethereal Sofia Boutella can elevate it above the confused melange of bizarre, meaningless imagery that it is. What little story there is could be summed up in a single sentence. The real low point is Nicolas Cage screaming about his testicle.

I really had an excellent time watching the movie "Willy's Wonderland", which was also starring Nicolas Cage. There he played a very cool guy, in a crazy but entertaining movie that took itself not too serious. I really had a good time.But this movie is just awful. The cut is confusing, the pictures irritating and the whole setting looks like the movie was made in a Walmart parking lot. Zero production value, set pieces and costumes are either second hand or the "artists" brought them from home.I mean, does this happen when people are in lockdown for a very long time? Get help, it's not too late...

reviews.review_title: not "the wildest movie Mr Cage ever made", but stupidest, so far .....
reviews.content: It's silly Japanese manga style fable about American domination, incorporating the nuclear fear syndrome. You can see bits and pieces of REPO! THE GENETIC OPERA (2008) or even APOCALYPSE NOW (1979), but basically PRISONERS OF THE GHOSTLAND (2021) is in the fashion of MAD MAX saga. A really delusional and degenerated Max.Reviewers will definitely make fun of Mr Cage. However there's no need to criticize him, or anyone in the cast and production team. I take pity on those investors/producers. They lost money, and must be ashamed to speak about where they stumbled.

It was pretty average to be honest, and so weird as well in some scenes I didn't even understand what was going on but it had it's action, fighting which it didn't make it boring but it felt dull and since Nicolas Cage is one of my favorite actors I expected more.
I've start watching this movie due to Nicholas cage only but it was a huge disappointment for me. I don't understand why this movie even made plotless & directionless, a total disaster.

Who knew he'd finally be sitting underneath garbage, on the smelly, swampy bottom of the can!In N. C.'s entire acting career, this is the absolute worst ever. He has done a lot of garbage, but this represents what is below all of the residual scrapings and run-off at the bottom of all the studios' worst. I never thought I'd see the day when he WOULD actually REEK!I hope he finishes paying off all of his collectors, soon, because as hard as I am trying to stick by his side by watching all of his crap since he went into debt, which is entirely based on nothing more than his absolute greed. As a spoiled Coppolla, he couldn't keep it in his pants (monet & credit cards).I don't think I can take much more... He's one of the finest stage & screen perfirmers/actors ever, but this "one" truly made me gag and puke!!! As bad as entertainment has been lately, I never thought I'd see it go this low, especially coming from someone as talented as he is. He almost soured me, recking my ability to watch any more of anything coming out of global Tinseltowns made by anyone, anywhere.Plz, something save him from himself, before anything great that he has done is totally annihilated, buried deep below his/this ever-growing barrage of straight-to-video garbage heap, wherein, he may never to be heard from (or of) ever again - - vanishing from the cinema world as though he never existed, without a hint of a trace - - ANYWHERE...!Nicholas who!?

reviews.review_title: Save your time. Watch something else.
reviews.content: For every 15 movie Nic makes we are lucky if one is good.... this was not one of the good ones.Nic is a good actor who unfortunately is money hungry and acts in many sub quality movies.This film was trying to be something that it was unable to attain. It had a target of being a wild, wacky movie, but unfortunately missed it by a long shot.

reviews.review_title: Oh boy words can't explain this
reviews.content: I'll watch just about anything with nic in but even I struggled through this garbage because nothing Really makes sense if your a nic cage fan avoid this one I beg you.

reviews.review_title: Kung Fu Cage loses the plot...
reviews.content: Well, here we go again folks. For every decent movie Nicolas Cage makes there are ten cr@p ones to endure, and trust me, Prisoners of the Ghostland is hands down one of his worst.Non-sensical, absurd genre-bending chaos, poor production values, it's all so truly bad i eventually switched off after Cage got one of his balls blown off and held it up to the camera.While I appreciate Cage has well-publicised massive debts to pay off, surely there are way better jobs than this available for an Osar winning actor who we all know can be amazing on his day when armed with a decent script.Sad to see the rich legacy of Cage classics like Rumble Fish, Birdy, Wild at Heart and Leaving Las Vegas sullied with utter tripe like this. Sort it out Nic, you're fast heading into braindead Bruce Willis and Tom Sizemore territory here. It's so unnecessary.

Nothing makes sense, its like the writer and director were sharing bad acid, really bad. Cage must have needed the money, the others looked like they tried, but what to do with such absurd characters in an ambience of lunacy. Kept thinking it had to get better but it didn't. All involved will carry the stigma for a lifetime.

?, is all I can say when I think about this movie. There is no way to explain what happens in the movie. Why are there cowboys and samurai, why does everything look super old but they have cars, why can nick cage speak English to people and they understand him. None of these things get answered and what's even worse is that the movie got more confusing as it went on. Even when they try to explain what happening in the movie it still makes no sense.When looking at the cast of the movie it makes sense why it is so bad. The whole movies budget went into getting Nick Cage. This is very prevalent as the whole movie is shot in a desert the entire time.Nick Cage could not save this movie even if he tried (wonder if it payed off his debt).

Ok I get it that its fantasy movie so there will be nonsense kind of scenes but I dont understand why noone shoot or attack cage. Like in that bank scene officers were even aiming cage but they dont shoot hin. And similarly while fighting with ghosts they all were just coming to get hit not even a single one was attacking.
